verses.kjv: And the LORD appeared unto him in the plains of Mamre: and he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day;
verses.ct: The LORD appeared to Abraham near the oaks of Mamre while he was sitting at the entrance of his tent during the hottest part of the day.

verses.kjv: And he lift up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself toward the ground,
verses.ct: He looked up and noticed three men standing nearby. As soon as he saw them, he rushed from the tent entrance to greet them and bowed low to the ground.

verses.kjv: And said, My LORD, if now I have found favour in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
verses.ct: He said, "My LORD, if I have found favor with you, please do not pass by your servant."

verses.kjv: Let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:
verses.ct: "Please, let some water be brought so you can wash your feet, and then rest under the tree."

verses.kjv: And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that ye shall pass on: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And they said, So do, as thou hast said.
verses.ct: "Let me bring some food so you can refresh yourselves. After that, you can continue on your way, since you have come to your servant." They replied, "Go ahead and do as you have said."

verses.kjv: And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said, Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth.
verses.ct: Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah and said, "Quickly, take three measures of fine flour, knead it, and bake bread."

verses.kjv: And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good, and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it.
verses.ct: Then Abraham ran to the herd, chose a young, tender calf, and gave it to a servant, who quickly prepared it.

verses.kjv: And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat.
verses.ct: He brought curds, milk, and the prepared calf and placed it all before them. He stood near them under the tree while they ate.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he said, Behold, in the tent.
verses.ct: They asked him, "Where is your wife Sarah?" He answered, "She is inside the tent."

verses.kjv: And he said, I will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard it in the tent door, which was behind him.
verses.ct: Then one of them said, "I will surely come back to you about this time next year, and Sarah your wife will have a son." Sarah was listening at the tent entrance behind him.

verses.kjv: Now Abraham and Sarah were old and well stricken in age; and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
verses.ct: Abraham and Sarah were both very old by now, and Sarah was past the age of childbearing.

verses.kjv: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?
verses.ct: So Sarah laughed to herself, thinking, "Now that I am worn out and my husband is old, will I really experience this joy?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of a surety bear a child, which am old?
verses.ct: The LORD said to Abraham, "Why did Sarah laugh and say, 'Can I really give birth when I am so old?'"

verses.kjv: Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.
verses.ct: "Is anything too difficult for the LORD? At the appointed time I will return to you, about this time next year, and Sarah will have a son."

verses.kjv: Then Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not; for she was afraid. And he said, Nay; but thou didst laugh.
verses.ct: Sarah denied it because she was afraid, saying, "I did not laugh." But he said, "No, you did laugh."

verses.kjv: And the men rose up from thence, and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
verses.ct: The men got up from there and turned their gaze toward Sodom, and Abraham walked along with them to see them off.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do;
verses.ct: The LORD said, "Should I conceal from Abraham what I am about to do?"

verses.kjv: Seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
verses.ct: "Abraham will certainly become a great and powerful nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed through him."

verses.kjv: For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him, and they shall keep the way of the LORD, to do justice and judgment; that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him.
verses.ct: "For I have chosen him so that he will direct his children and his household after him to follow the way of the LORD by doing what is just and right, so that the LORD may fulfill for Abraham everything he has promised him."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous;
verses.ct: Then the LORD said, "The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is enormous, and their sin is extremely severe."

verses.kjv: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.
verses.ct: "I will go down and determine whether their actions fully match the outcry that has reached me. If not, I will find out."

verses.kjv: And the men turned their faces from thence, and went toward Sodom: but Abraham stood yet before the LORD.
verses.ct: The men turned from there and headed toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
verses.ct: Abraham stepped closer and said, "Will you really sweep away the righteous along with the wicked?"

verses.kjv: Peradventure there be fifty righteous within the city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are therein?
verses.ct: "What if there are fifty righteous people in the city? Will you still destroy it rather than spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous who are there?"

verses.kjv: That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
verses.ct: "Far be it from you to do such a thing — to kill the righteous with the wicked, treating the righteous the same as the wicked. Far be it from you! Will not the Judge of all the earth do what is right?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.
verses.ct: The LORD said, "If I find fifty righteous people in the city of Sodom, I will spare the entire place for their sake."

verses.kjv: And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the LORD, which am but dust and ashes:
verses.ct: Abraham spoke up again: "I realize I have been bold enough to speak to the LORD, even though I am nothing but dust and ashes."

verses.kjv: Peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous: wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five? And he said, If I find there forty and five, I will not destroy it.
verses.ct: "What if the fifty righteous are short by five? Will you destroy the whole city because of five?" He answered, "If I find forty-five there, I will not destroy it."

verses.kjv: And he spake unto him yet again, and said, Peradventure there shall be forty found there. And he said, I will not do it for forty’s sake.
verses.ct: Abraham spoke to him once more: "What if only forty are found there?" He replied, "I will not do it for the sake of forty."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Oh let not the LORD be angry, and I will speak: Peradventure there shall thirty be found there. And he said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.
verses.ct: Then Abraham said, "Please, do not let the LORD be angry, but let me speak. What if only thirty are found there?" He answered, "I will not do it if I find thirty there."

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the LORD: Peradventure there shall be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for twenty’s sake.
verses.ct: Abraham said, "I know I have been bold to speak to the LORD, but what if only twenty are found there?" He replied, "I will not destroy it for the sake of twenty."

verses.kjv: And he said, Oh let not the LORD be angry, and I will speak yet but this once: Peradventure ten shall be found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for ten’s sake.
verses.ct: Then Abraham said, "Please, do not let the LORD be angry, and I will speak just one more time. What if only ten are found there?" He answered, "I will not destroy it for the sake of ten."

verses.kjv: And the LORD went his way, as soon as he had left communing with Abraham: and Abraham returned unto his place.
verses.ct: When the LORD had finished speaking with Abraham, he departed, and Abraham went back home.
